<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This defines the abstract base interface for a ThreadPool allowing</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><Highlight kind="comment">/// asynchronous parallel execution on a defined number of threads.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><Highlight kind="comment">/// It is possible to reuse one thread pool for different groups of tasks</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><Highlight kind="comment">/// by grouping tasks using ThreadPoolTaskGroup. All tasks are processed using</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the same queue, but it is possible to wait only for a specific group of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><Highlight kind="comment">/// tasks to finish.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><Highlight kind="comment">/// It is also possible for worker threads to submit new tasks and wait for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><Highlight kind="comment">/// them. Note that this may result in a deadlock in cases such as when a task</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><Highlight kind="comment">/// (directly or indirectly) tries to wait for its own completion, or when all</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><Highlight kind="comment">/// available threads are used up by tasks waiting for a task that has no thread</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><Highlight kind="comment">/// left to run on (this includes waiting on the returned future). It should be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><Highlight kind="comment">/// generally safe to wait() for a group as long as groups do not form a cycle.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/threadpoolinterface"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/threadpoolinterface">ThreadPoolInterface</a> &#123;</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The actual method to enqueue a task to be defined by the concrete</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// implementation.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">virtual</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> asyncEnqueue(std::function&lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">()&gt; Task,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// thread may participate in the execution of the pending tasks.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Blocking wait for all the threads to complete and the queue to be empty.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// It is an error to try to add new tasks while blocking on this call.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Calling wait() from a task would deadlock waiting for itself.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/threadpoolinterface/#a0ea46b29f97f4f535c563a68a38185a4"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">virtual</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/threadpoolinterface/#a0ea46b29f97f4f535c563a68a38185a4">wait</a>() = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Blocking wait for only all the threads in the given group to complete.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// It is possible to wait even inside a task, but waiting (directly or</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// indirectly) on itself will deadlock. If called from a task running on a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// worker thread, the call may process pending tasks while waiting in order</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// not to waste the thread.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/threadpoolinterface/#ad4dbcf0b0e80230eb3f28d30672eff19"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">virtual</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/threadpoolinterface/#ad4dbcf0b0e80230eb3f28d30672eff19">wait</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/threadpooltaskgroup">ThreadPoolTaskGroup</a> &amp;Group) = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Asynchronous submission of a task to the pool. The returned future can be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// used to wait for the task to finish and is &#42;non-blocking&#42; on destruction.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><Highlight kind="comment">/// A ThreadPool implementation using std::threads.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The pool keeps a vector of threads alive, waiting on a condition variable</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><Highlight kind="comment">/// for some work to become available.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">StdThreadPool : </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/threadpoolinterface">ThreadPoolInterface</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Construct a pool using the hardware strategy \\p S for mapping hardware</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// execution resources (threads, cores, CPUs)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Defaults to using the maximum execution resources in the system, but</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// accounting for the affinity mask.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><Highlight kind="normal">  StdThreadPool(ThreadPoolStrategy S = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a00440f10281348fd9f7be52e23c7c874">hardware&#95;concurrency</a>());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Blocking destructor: the pool will wait for all the threads to complete.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><Highlight kind="normal">  ~StdThreadPool() </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">override</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Blocking wait for all the threads to complete and the queue to be empty.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// It is an error to try to add new tasks while blocking on this call.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Calling wait() from a task would deadlock waiting for itself.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> wait() </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">override</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Blocking wait for only all the threads in the given group to complete.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// It is possible to wait even inside a task, but waiting (directly or</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// indirectly) on itself will deadlock. If called from a task running on a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// worker thread, the call may process pending tasks while waiting in order</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// not to waste the thread.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> wait(ThreadPoolTaskGroup &amp;Group) </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">override</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Returns the maximum number of worker threads in the pool, not the current</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// number of threads!</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> getMaxConcurrency()</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const override </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> MaxThreadCount; &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> requestedThreads;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="168"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Lock the queue and push the new task</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"><Highlight kind="normal">      std::unique&#95;lock&lt;std::mutex&gt; LockGuard(QueueLock);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Don&#39;t allow enqueueing after disabling the pool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(EnableFlag &amp;&amp; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Queuing a thread during ThreadPool destruction&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="174"><Highlight kind="normal">      Tasks.emplace&#95;back(std::make&#95;pair(std::move(Task), Group));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="175"><Highlight kind="normal">      requestedThreads = ActiveThreads + Tasks.size();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="176"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="260"><Highlight kind="comment">/// A group of tasks to be run on a thread pool. Thread pool tasks in different</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="261"><Highlight kind="comment">/// groups can run on the same threadpool but can be waited for separately.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="262"><Highlight kind="comment">/// It is even possible for tasks of one group to submit and wait for tasks</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="263"><Highlight kind="comment">/// of another group, as long as this does not form a loop.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
